update.description:
To be used with [ign-rendering PR](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/238)

This PR sets default PBR properties \(currently only metalness value\) for mesh loaders that do not natively support PBR.

The main motivation behind this PR is to reduce the effort needed when porting models from gazebo-classic to ignition. There is a noticeable shading difference between ogre 1.x and ogre 2.x. One factor is ogre 2.x’s default metalness value that causes objects to appear darker when compared to ogre 1.x. With these changes and the [ign-rendering PR](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/238), the models should appear brighter.

The changes should not affect users who are already using PBR maps \(metalness, normal, and roughness maps\) for their models because the default values are overriden. e.g. subt should not be affected.

Other thing I’ve considered:

* It is possible for users to override the metalness value through SDF but that involves modifying the model.sdf files of all assets. It is also not straight forward when there are multiple submeshes in a mesh with different textures.
* Override metalness value in the ign-gazebo level. This is not desirable as we integrate new mesh formats with PBR support in the future, e.g. glTF2. The metalness value specified in the mesh would be overriden.

**Update:**

Ended up changing default metalness value in common::Pbr class.
update.title: Set default PBR metalness value

content.raw: Sounds good, let's hope this doesn't make anyone shinier than they expect :fingers_crossed: :pray:

content.raw:
oh yeah forgot about these shiny simple shapes :sparkles:

~~I’ll leave the changes as they are now~~

Edit: actually, I’ll update the default value in common::Pbr since there could be users using ign-rendering outside of ign-gazebo.

[threejs' metalness value](https://threejs.org/docs/#api/en/materials/MeshStandardMaterial.metalness) also defaults to 0.0
content.html:
oh yeah forgot about these shiny simple shapes

I’ll leave the changes as they are now

Edit: actually, I’ll update the default value in common::Pbr since there could be users using ign-rendering outside of ign-gazebo.

threejs' metalness value also defaults to 0.0

content.raw: At least on `ign-gazebo`, I think simple shapes are setting their own metalness to 1.0 already, if no material is given: #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/src/48e1f4bc86b382ba75e7fa3a5ed8348b9bd7f7b1/src/rendering/SceneManager.cc#lines-255
content.html: At least on ign-gazebo, I think simple shapes are setting their own metalness to 1.0 already, if no material is given: #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/src/48e1f4bc86b382ba75e7fa3a5ed8348b9bd7f7b1/src/rendering/SceneManager.cc#lines-255

content.raw: Yes. We could also choose to update the default metalness value to 0.0 in common::Pbr class, which affects all models regardless of whether they are loaded from a mesh or not, i.e. affects simple shapes.
content.html: Yes. We could also choose to update the default metalness value to 0.0 in common::Pbr class, which affects all models regardless of whether they are loaded from a mesh or not, i.e. affects simple shapes.

content.raw: Got it. So the confusing part is: is the default metalness value `0.0` or `0.5`?
content.html: Got it. So the confusing part is: is the default metalness value 0.0 or 0.5?

content.raw:
> Wouldn't it be better to go ahead and specify some default values for other properties too?

The other properties will use the default values from the ign::common::Pbr class:

[#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/src/9bb7e81da6065268c5aec947d94ee6c3c673cad9/graphics/src/Pbr.cc#lines-24](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/src/9bb7e81da6065268c5aec947d94ee6c3c673cad9/graphics/src/Pbr.cc#lines-24)

> But they will affect `ogre2` users not using PBR, right? Do you think it's worth the risk of introducing this into Blueprint / Citadel at this point?

It’ll affect ogre2 users using dae / obj files without specifying PBR `<material>` . I thought about putting this change in ign-common4 / Dome but went with the idea of introducing this change early when there are fewer ignition users. One main reason behind this is that since Ignition citadel is a LTS, people may stick to this version until the next ignition LTS. By then, there could be several more assets created and tuned for current metalness value. 

‌
content.html:
Wouldn't it be better to go ahead and specify some default values for other properties too?

The other properties will use the default values from the ign::common::Pbr class:

#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/src/9bb7e81da6065268c5aec947d94ee6c3c673cad9/graphics/src/Pbr.cc#lines-24

But they will affect ogre2 users not using PBR, right? Do you think it's worth the risk of introducing this into Blueprint / Citadel at this point?

It’ll affect ogre2 users using dae / obj files without specifying PBR <material> . I thought about putting this change in ign-common4 / Dome but went with the idea of introducing this change early when there are fewer ignition users. One main reason behind this is that since Ignition citadel is a LTS, people may stick to this version until the next ignition LTS. By then, there could be several more assets created and tuned for current metalness value.

‌

content.raw:
> currently only metalness value

Wouldn't it be better to go ahead and specify some default values for other properties too?

> The changes should not affect users who are already using PBR maps

But they will affect `ogre2` users not using PBR, right? Do you think it's worth the risk of introducing this into Blueprint / Citadel at this point?
content.html:
currently only metalness value

Wouldn't it be better to go ahead and specify some default values for other properties too?

The changes should not affect users who are already using PBR maps

But they will affect ogre2 users not using PBR, right? Do you think it's worth the risk of introducing this into Blueprint / Citadel at this point?
